Congratulations to Junior Elton Carlson of Farmersville for receiving his high school diploma on his 90th birthday on August 1st!

Mr. Carlson left high school to join the military and ended up serving for 42 years. Through the ‚ÄúOperation Recognition‚Äù program any veteran who served in the armed forces during the Vietnam War, Korean Conflict or World War II and who was unable to complete a secondary education may be awarded a high school diploma based on knowledge and expertise gained while in service.

Mr. Carlson‚Äôs family reached out to the Bolivar-Richburg administration who helped process the paperwork and secured approval for the diploma.

Thank you, Mr. Carlson, for your service to our country. (And happy belated birthday! )

Bus Monitor
Bus Driver

Approximately 4 hours per day for Bus Driver
Bus assignments may vary.

The salary will be paid in accordance with the salary schedule outlined in the CSEA negotiated agreement.

Applications are available on our website www.brcs.wnyric.org or in the main office at either campus. If you are interested in applying, please submit your application by Friday, August 14, 2019 to: Ann Feuchter, Transportation Supervisor, Bolivar-Richburg Central School, 100 School Street, Bolivar, NY 14715.
